transcript:
This is waterfall fried chicken, and it's one of the most
viral street foods in Vietnam. They start by pre-cooking some
chicken and then turning on this hot oil waterfall, which sounds almost exactly
like heavy rainfall. Once the chicken crisps up and turns
a beautiful golden brown color, they flip it over to get a
crust on the bottom side. And once it's fully cooked, they drain off the excess oil
and rest it for a few moments to lock in all the juices. It's served with an orange fried
rice that's cooked by a robot, as well as fresh vegetables.
